restaurants.name: Lil' Frankie's
restaurants.comments: Lil' Frankie's is a NYC classic. Although seating is tight, the food is worth it. My two favorite items on the menu are the calamari and the spaghetti limone. I would recommend booking a reservation in advance.

restaurants.name: Petrarca Cucina E Vino
restaurants.comments: This is a hole in the wall place for great wine, pasta, and creme brulee. No reservation necessary, as there is usually seating available at the bar after 8 pm. The Fettucine alla Bolognese and Lasagna della Mamma are both amazing.

restaurants.name: Little Owl
restaurants.comments: I went here for brunch recently and got the chilaquiles, which was to die for. Only criticism I have is that it is a wine bar only, saw all cocktails are made with wine. I personally don't mind, but their blood mary's were weaker than average.

restaurants.name: Misi
restaurants.comments: I truly think Misi can do no wrong. Everything on the menu was a hit. Only downsides are that it is pretty difficult to get a reservation, and it is expensive.

restaurants.name: aurora
restaurants.comments: Awesome food, cool ambiance, spicy bloody mary's. I love this place for brunch. It's extra awesome if you get the pleasure of sitting in their conservatory.
